alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Franklin; Hocking; Pickaway; Ross (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 01 at 2:32AM EDT until April 01 at 3:00AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 300 AM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN FRANKLIN...WESTERN FAIRFIELD...WEST CENTRAL HOCKING...EASTERN PICKAWAY AND NORTHEASTERN ROSS COUNTIES... At 231 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Ashville to 7 miles south of New Holland, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Lancaster, Pickerington, Circleville, Canal Winchester, Ashville, Baltimore, Kingston, Logan Elm Village, Royalton, Lithopolis, Amanda, Stoutsville, Laurelville, Carroll, Adelphi, Tarlton, Fairfield County Airport, East Ringgold, US Route 22 at State Route 159 and Slate Run Metro Park. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
